location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Printed letter No.58 of 1864 from Lieutenant-Colonel Lewis Pelly, Political Resident, Persian Gulf to Henry Lacon Anderson, Chief Secretary to Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: Report by Pelly of his visit to the plateau of Gusakan along with a sketch map of the area and itineraries showing the estimated distances, in fursacks, of Pelly's route.The report gives details of the geographical layout of the plateau including altitudes for the various villages and landmarks therein before going in to specific detail on the passes between the Gusakan bluff and the Khormooj hill and their routes.The report also includes sketch diagrams of a fire temple, or altar, at Posthepar which Pelly believed he was the first European to have seen.
